derivation: a primitive root (probably identical with H5286 (נָעַר), through the idea of the rustling of mane, which usually accompanies the lion's roar);
outline:
1. to shake, shake out or off
    1. (Qal) to shake out, show emptiness
    2. (Niphal)
      1. to be shaken
      2. to shake oneself
    3. (Piel) to shake off or out
    4. (Hithpael) to shake oneself
kjv_def: shake (off, out, self), overthrow, toss up and down.
